Classes in alma.scheduling.planning_mode_sim.define used by alma.scheduling.planning_mode_sim.define
AntennaProperty
          The AntennaProperty class denotes the properties of an antenna that are relevant to the scheduling subsystem.
ArchiveEntity
          The ArchiveEntity interface defines common attributes that all entries into the archive must have.
ArrayTime
          ArrayTime is based on the definition of time from the OMG Time Service Specification.
BasicComponent
          Description
Clock
          The Clock interface provides the current time, the precise geographical location of the clock and time zone information.
ClockAlarmListener
          The ClockAlarmListener is an interface that is called by the Clock class whenever an alarm expires.
ClockBase
          The ClockBase class is an abstract class from which actual implementations, i.e.
ComponentImplBase
          The ComponentImplBase is a variant of the class with the same name in the ACS component directory.
ComponentState
          The State class describes the state of the scheduling system.
Date
          Record the date as year, month, and day.
DateTime
          Create an instant in time.
Ecliptical
          Ecliptical coordinates -- clestial longitude, latitude, and the equinox.
Equatorial
          Equatorial coordinates -- right ascension, declination, and the equinox.
Expression
          The Expression class accepts a logical expression in the form of a string, parses and stores it.
FlowControlExpression
          Flow control expressions are used to constrain the order in which members of an SUnitSet are executed.
FrequencyBand
          The FrequencyBand class specifies the name and the range of frequencies in a particular frequency band.
HasMembers
          The HasMembers interface is a collection of methods that must be implemented by all objects that belong to a project that can themselves contain members.
MemberOf
          Description
NotifyPI
          A NotifyPI object cantains a logical expression and a mode (either blocking or non-blocking).
ObsUnitSet
          This is a substitute for the ObsUnitSet class that is really defined in the ObsPrep subsystem.
Priority
          The Priority class implements a priority that varies from 1 (lowest) to 10 (highest).
SchedBlock
          This is a substitute for the SchedBlock class that is really defined in the ObsPrep subsystem.
SExec
          Description
SPolicyFactor
          Description
SProject
          An SProject is an observing project as viewed by the scheduling subsystem.
Status
          The Status class is used ot denote the status of an SUnit.
SUnit
          An SUnit is the lowest-level, atomic scheduling unit.
SUnitSet
          A SUnitSet is a hierarchical tree whose leaves are SUnit objects.
SystemSetup
          The SystemSetup class defines the initial setup that is required of a scheduling block.
Target
          Description
Time
          The current time based on a 24-hour clock.
TimeInterval
          The TimeInterval is a utility class used to define an interval of time between two STime objects.
WeatherCondition
          The WeatherCondition class defines a measure of the favorable conditions under which a block may be executed.
